siteMetadata.title: Blog by Tableau Tim
siteMetadata.subtitle: Data, quantifiedself and everything in between.

frontmatter.title: #tabtQS 2: Google location history in Tableau
frontmatter.description: In case you missed post #1 check it out here, however this post is about Google location history. On the 19th June I gave a short talk on the Quantified Self and the iterative process by which I explore the data I collect and improve the way in which I handle it. In the talk I showed in 5 minutes how you could get hold of the location data that Google has in a JSON format and  then very quickly visualise it in Tableau. This blog post will summarise the steps you need to take and what you need to do in Tableau.

frontmatter.title: #tabtQS 1: RescueTime in Tableau
frontmatter.description: Leading up to several talks I'll be giving in April, I'm going to do a series of mini posts highlighting the process behind the quantified self workflows that I use. These will typically include Tableau and Alteryx so think of this as a how to guide geared towards these tools or more a workflow to replicate in your tool of choice. This week its Rescue Time.

frontmatter.title: Ad-hoc data collection for Tableau analysis: Quantified self, Workflow & Google Sheets
frontmatter.description: In this post, find out how to maintain some clarity and focus in your dashboard designs using three really simple techniques to make sure you build something functional and clear.

frontmatter.title: Barcelona Marathon 2016 Route Scout
frontmatter.description: I recently had the chance to work with some data from AirBnB. For the viz I built i just tried to use standard features and apply some AirBnb branding.
